column4: Delicious food, super reasonable price, good location, fast service. Also dishes to share. Highly recommended!

My family and I enjoyed the food and service so much that we went there twice more during our stay in New York. The food is so yummy and fresh! The service is superb! And it's even cheap! We loved it! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

column3: Fabulous! Real fresh and cheap pasta!
column4: Fantastic place in central Manhattan for quick, fresh cheap eats! Highly recommend this place, spaghetti Bol only $12 cooked fresh in front of you. A must for pasta lovers especially with families for a cheap eat!

Beautiful venue with views of the Hudson. There were 2 wedding receptions the night we visited. This is a large space with lots of windows. Make your reservations in advance. Service was excellent. Food very good.
We decided to give it a try. We had a dinner with our friends and we all had a nice time. Pasta was very good. Friendly staff. Would recommend.
We ordered a family meal/4 persons of spaghetti with meatballs. Good, tasty. Nice seating. Would go thete again. Fair price.
I generally have the spaghetti pomodaro with vegetables here and it's really good. Good value for money compare to order places. Quick. Clean. Friendly
Nice salads and pastas. Quick service lunch time even though it looks crazy busy. Worth a stop in for lunch.

column3: Good food at a fair price
column4: We had lunch here. Good quality food at a fair price. Tasty and generous portions. The service was efficient and friendly.
Good pasta. Good Price. Good service. Highly recommended to eat an Italian food in NYC. Obviously, the place is a fast food restaurant but honest and healthy.

Came across this place by walking the street and in much need of some good food and some relaxation. Wholesome bean soup followed by a pizza with the best base and crust.All home cooking.Friendly staff and a relaxing venue.
Our family had the Vesuvio and the Bolognese pastas, and also a Lasagna and all were great and tastefull, with prices really reasonable, so we highly recommand the place for lunch and also dinner.

column3: Quick food pleasant atmosphere and polite staff
column4: Great food good taste, quick service good for a quick meal. Or lunchtime. Could do with some starters or sides such as garlic bread. Would go again.

It‚Äôs just two blks. from MOMA and makes a great stop before, during, or after. The salad with grilled salmon was especially fine. The salmon was moist and creamy on the inside- couldn‚Äôt have been better.
Most fast or semi-fast Italian restaurants are so so. Barilla has properly prepared pastas and ragus. You should try the amitricana.
Barilla is a good spot for lunch when you're craving pasta or pizza. The service is fairly quick, there's ample seating and the food is very good.

Spent an hour here having their wonderfully crafted coffee with pizza which stand out clearly... Tue buzz at the place coupled with the live kitchen add that bit of fun to the place that makes it endearing
Order your pasta at the counter and then quickly grab a seat. A few minutes later the staff will bring your order to you.
We love this place for the appetizers. Don‚Äôt forget to order speciality drinks as they are the best. The main course was better than most, but some of our crew disagreed with me.

These guys really know how to make pasta. It‚Äôs consistently perfect. Nice people especially the evening crew. Salad is just ok but this really is the place to go if you want good solid food in an informal atmosphere.

column3: great food for a good price
column4: I was surprised to find decently priced Italian food in NYC! Cooked to order and and open kitchen make this place wonderful. The pasta is well done, easy to order and you can watch them prepare your meal. Quick and friendly staff.

column3: Great Italien Food at big apple
column4: After a long day in New York we want to eat fresh Italien food. Here we had pizza and pasta and it was delicious. The prices are less for NYC and you can be well sated. Enjoy!

Very reasonably priced and the food is excellent I had pasta which was delicious my friend had the Italian meats & cheeses very high quality cheese & meats and the other order was a Mediterranean salad also very tasty . We will be back
Went here with a group of 8. They were super nice to us! The food was good and there was lots of variety. The salads were also excellent and they had no problems with a couple of special orders
Shows and feels a little bit like a canteen, but when you consider the pricing in this expensive area, anyone will agree its worth going here.
Looking for a place to sit and grab something fairly healthy to eat and get going again, this was ideal. They have everything from small pizzas, lasagna, panini, and serves beer and wine.
It was a bit of a walk from central park but really worth finding it. Delicious hearty pure Italian pasta and sauce. Portion size very generous and nice relaxing place to sit and wind down.
Good little pasta joint that whole family was able to find dish they all liked while on holiday for spring break.

column3: Tasty pasta in a quiet place
column4: Excellent quiet place to eat pasta, pizza or Lasagna in the heart of Manhattan. Tasty food and very good service.
Pre-matinee meal that didn't break the bank. Not a fancy restaurant. It is more like a fast food pace with good, tasty food made to order.

i have visited all of the Barilla Restaurants a number of times and consider them a good value. Self serve style similar to Vapiano. Atmosphere is comfortable and spacious, pasta is good and the workers are accomodative.

If you looking for an Italian restaurant during your stay in Manhattan this the right place. Pasta is al dente like Italy with an affordable price if you compare to the other restaurants . Kids will love it
We have go for diner, the place was very cool and frozen, the pasta was bad cook and cool, the pitzza was very good, but I do not recomend this place is you have not a steel stomac.

column3: Bad music for listening during the meals
column4: The place is cheap and service is nice, but the music is too loud and not adequate to the meal moment
This place was amazing. The rigatoni was incredible. The service as well. Environment was peaceful, such a great place to have lunch or dinner. I will definately return on our next visit to NYC ‚ù§

Service slow despite no crowd. However. Eggs Benedict delicious. Instead of English muffin,the bread portion was a fluffy pancake type bread.hollandaise light and delicious.poached egg on top perfectly cooked. My husband had green omelet with salmon side and was very pleased.
Nothing special, pasta tasted really flat. Good thing that it was possible to order pasta in whole grain.
great food, filling portions, good value for money, very friendly staff. they accommodated change to their menu by allowing substitutions WHERE POSSIBLE.
Stopped in for a quick lunch and we ordered a panini and pizza and both were very good. Seating was a little tough as it was very busy on a Saturday afternoon during the holidays.
My 11 year old daughter and I loved the pasta and soup. The server was excellent too. The food came quick and hot.
We ate pizza and spaghetti Bolognaise but pizza had a thick bread and not much topping. Spaghetti didn't have much sauce and meat on it. I'd say it's OK but not very tasty and not special.
We have just taken our student group of 24 here and the staff were very accomodating. Good was fresh and delicious. Restaurant very clean. Thank you for having us üòä

column3: Good place for Pasta in Times Square
column4: We were in Times Square and went there twice. It was the onlz place where our kids enjoyed pasta. Well it is still with American taste but quite good. I suggest tagliatelle bolognese, I do not suggest farfalle genovese.

Nice atmosphere for quick dinning. Our family of 4 split Metro sized Margherita Pizza and the Fusilli Montanara pasta dish. It was just enough for us and light enough to not weigh us down. Would definitely visit again!

column3: I felt like i was back in Italy
column4: Stumbled upon this place. This is my 2nd visit. I will be back. Resonably priced for Midtown Manhattan, clean, friendly and the food is good. Just accross the Street from Bryant Park

We were there at noon, far away from peak hours to avoid queues and slow service. Everytjmhing was fine, kids menu with penne pomodoro, easier to eat than spaghetti and good for adults on our choice,too: try the penne with salmon , it was delicious.
Food quality is somewhere between Olive Garden and the many local Italian places in Midtown. Prices are cheap for Midtown, so a good option for a family on a budget

I stumbled upon this place and had a good meal, the kind that is easy to make at home. Different types of pasta; different types of toppings: veggies, fish, shrimp, meat. They serve wine and beer. Did not have a chance to try their desserts
Good find in the city. The lasagna was delicious! The tortellini was good as well. The pizza was quite small. I would go there again. It's nothing fancy.

Cozy restaurant where you order your pizza & pasta at the cashier and is served to your table once is ready. Enjoyed freshly prepared meal, good for a quick and non-expensive meal near the 5th-6th avenues in Manhattan where usually everything is highly pricey!
Food was wonderful. Recommend the Lasagne, Tortellini and the Rigatoni. Smaller portions but delicious. Wish bread was served with the food but isn't
Refreshing to get good tasting food in a nice atmosphere at a reasonable price inn the middle of mid town New York. Would go back again!
I came with my big family to get something to eat before taking a train at Penn Station and we really enjoyed the place: good food and prices, friendly and quick service, excellent!!
good atmosphere and soo good food i really like visit here with my man,i like that staff are so friendly
Really good and cheap for that area at 5th avenue. Service friendly and location nice ! Waited not long for our order. Was tasty and we will come back.
friendly staff. will return again when back in town. felt like cheap option. glad that the staff were kind.

column3: Very good Italian eatery, no fuss.
column4: Must try amattriciana. Loved it. Very good traditional recipes with high quality ingredients, served in an informal, trattoria-style place. Not pricey, great for a fast lunch or dinner that doesnt taste like fast food.
Soups, pizza and pasta place. A small menu but a tasty one. Medium size portions but good enough to not waste any food.

We failed to make reservations for dinner and had to scramble to find any place to eat. A couple can enjoy pasta and salad here and add a glass of wine for only $3 bucks. Hard to beat this option in New York!
I came here while I was on holiday the staff are friendly I will definately return an would reccomend to others
that sums it all. Pastas at his best, we really like this place, the chicken alfredo spaghetti was amazing
Quiet and pleasant. Good coffee and $1 croissants make this the bargain of bargains! Nice music and super pleasant employees.
Clean restaurant, easy to place order, very good pasta, however, it comes with so little meat and one has to pay extra to add more meat ;-)
The place is great but a little bit expansive,the meal was tasty,salads were better than pasta,excellent.

column3: Great food and a great price!!
column4: Probably the best food we had while visiting New York! Service was 11/10...really friendly staff, and food delicious and freshly prepared! Thank you!!!

Great option!! Tasty pasta in general, tortellini missed some seasoning . Great price for central NYC. Needs to have more waiters, cheese and bread took long to come. Family platter not enough for the number of people recommended. Overall really good place!
I visited the restaurant on a quiet night. The servers were so friendly and helpful and my order came quite quickly. They had quite a few choices on their menu and I thought my pasta was great!
I had a lovely Tortellini Alfredo here. Nicely cooked, good portion, priced reasonably with quick service. A good choice if you want to have a quick and nice lunch after the visit of MONA.

column3: Quick and delicious and Gluten Free
column4: We were tired and hungry and found this place. The gluten free pasta is superb and we both thoroughly enjoyed our quick, very tasty meal at a very reasonable cost
Love it here. The food is amazing and the service is great! I usually go to enjoy the pizza. However I hear most of the items on the menu are good.
For a quick meal, with an open kitchen good service quality Italian food, we ate the pasta amatriciana and pizza margarita an ideal restaurant for children

Quick service restaurant, but pasta is one of the most delicious I have ever ate! Pasta is extremely delicious, perfectly cooked! Salad was made with fresh products, really good! The staff is very friendly and helpful! My family and me had a very delightful dinner!
So, the family and me stepped in from the cold and was pleasantly surprised by this place. The pasta fagioli was extremely homey and was just what we needed to shake off the cop.

This is a reasonably-priced restaurant close to the theater district, where you can get tasty Italian food. You order at the register and they bring you the food. The night we went, there were many seating options. The food was very good.
Good service, great food and quality plus nice ambience. Is a fast food type of place where you order and they bring it to the table. Lovely set up. "Servers" are always around if you need something.

column3: Nice quick lunch for a moderate price
column4: The place is nice, gets a little crowded, but the serve fast. The prices and food is nice. Would recommend if you need to eat quickly and keep going.
I was quiet suprised as I saw this restaurant because I know the Barilla pasta "boxes".. Food is great here, quick and delicious in a good value for money.
This was exactly what we were looking for, a nice salad (Nizzarda), with tuna and lots of other goodies. The staff is friendly and helpful to a high degree. Excellent!!

The service was great, staff helping our largish party seated and fed even at rush hour. The pasta was okay, but not remarkable. We ate plenty, and did it quickly. The prices were imminently reasonable. That was the goal.
Was very impressed with this place. Can see the food being prepared right in front of you all fresh and is brought to your table within minutes. Was really tasty and inexpensive.
Comfortable atmosphere, not that rushed feeling. Pasta cooked very well, sauces fresh. Price is right.

column3: Good food and quiet at 32nd street
column4: We ate different pastas, lasagna and minestrone soup. All was tasty, service was relatively fast. We also enjoyed their cafe latte and cake. We enjoyed the food and equally important the cozy atmosphere. The cost was reasonable.
Great place to get some reasonable Italian food. Some of the servings were a little small. Lasagna was good size & taste
This is the place you have to go to eat a plate of pasta the Italian way in New York! Prices are very reasonable too.

i came for breakfast and ordered scramble eggs and i got them with bread and nice jam. to drink i ordered cappuccino that was hardly warm ,since i was already late i had no time to complain but its not o.k. anyway
Quick service but small portions for the price. Especially comparing to other NYC Italian joints.. Not a place worth stopping in the area
Reasonable pasta and sandwiches. Can be busy. Average service. Pretty clean and comfortable. Not a destination per se but does the job in a hurry.
Perfect location and good service. We ordered two pastas.. the Farfalle Genovesi and Linguine Vesuvio. Both were good, however i liked the Linguine more.
Great pasta experience at very affordable price. If you want Italian food, don't spend $$$$. Barilla is a great option and even open late (real European style).
We stopped by here on the way back to the hotel and got a great deal on fresh pasta to share. Farfalle Genovesi. Pesto, feta cheese, tomatoes. Delicious!
I enjoyed a lot! My favorite brand of pasta, the place is very cozy, great vibe, delicious, price is fair, fast.. Just the way I like.
Great value for money, wonderful raw materials! visited August 2016 with friends and ate several excellent dishes. take the Alfredo!
Wanted to find a low cost alternative for at least one meal on our stay. The place was cute and fun. The staff is extremely friendly also. We'd come back again!
Was in NYC n it was time for my 2yr old's lunch. All I needed was a pasta dish with meat. We had the bolognaise many it was so good I finished mine and ate up the rest of his :)
Went with 3 families and had EXCELLENT service and food. Our kids especially liked Fusili Montanara, but all the plates were good. They have espresso for after meal as well.
Excellent food. Family of four, with teenagers, and all happy. We ordered: Penne al Salmone; Lasagna Parm (eggplant); Tortellini Al Fredo with sausage; Spaghetti Alfrefo with chicken. Yum x 4!
Visited the restaurant with family, while visiting New York City. Was excellent value and very fast and friendly service. Recommend for a quick and tasty meal.

column3: Pasta Like You Eat at Home
column4: Barilla as in the same Barilla pasta you buy in the grocery store cooked for you. It's nice to eat something familiar when you're traveling once in awhile. Very reasonably priced, you can make this a relatively quick stop or stay a relax.

It is hard to find bargain food in Midtown. Barilla has great food, good service and excellent pizza. We had the Salame, which is a great pepperoni pizza, and Nobile, a shaved parmigiana and prosciutto ham pizza, which was wolfed down. Highly recommended.
Being an Italian and thus a real pasta lover, I recommend this restaurant for quality of products and price. Excellent!
The place is in the center of the masses. Very quiet comparing to where it's located. Very comfortable to stay and eat in it. The food is tasty and priced quite fairly. The stuff were nice and quick.
Pasta, panini, piza, salads and soup. All of them fantastic. Very tasty food. Fast and cheap! We spent a week in NY and we repeated twice.

column3: Pasta not ready and dirty tables
column4: We were three friends that went out for a chill dinner, we didn't expect anything fancy but what we got was bad - the pasta wasn't ready and the food was not tasty, further on the tables were dirty and the staff unprofessional
No parmigiano available, we had to select different pasta, because Fusilli were out. Cook missed pepper and salt. Never again.
My lasagna was ice cold in the middle, and know what, they reheated it in a MICRO.... I got so dissapointedüò© This means that probably much of the food has been frozen!
We stopped for lunch since the place was not busy. The service was fast but the food was just about average and nothing special
Food-price balance was perfect! We were tired of paying too much money for nothing! This place serves fair food for fair price. Pastas are delicious. Especially salads are good!
Second visit to this restaurant same quality of food with the same standard service, prices still reasonable for me with many Italian food selections I recommend for fast restaurant visiting.
My boyfriend and I went for a late breakfast early lunch here a couple of time on our 1 week stay here near by! Such a delicious meal &The staff we're very welcoming! Highly recommended
Found this place by chance and couldn't believe our luck! I ordered a large pizza. Big mistake. It was HUGE! Had to get it to go. Really friendly staff. Reasonable prices. Recommended highly!

Great atmosphere, great food- pizza and pasta, with big portions. Also, friendly staff and great Italian music playing in the background. I liked too how you can buy Barilla pasta there and other things such as cook books!

column3: Straighforward, tasty Italian cuisine at the right price
column4: It has the feel of a fast food joint, but the service and the quality of the food give the lie to that first impression. Good value for money and centrally located, if visiting MOMA among other local points of interest.

We grabbed a pizza for two and headed over to Bryant Park for dining al fresco. Enjoyed the park and all the people visiting and playing frisbee and football catch. Pizza was tasty and cooked just right.
The Mediterranean salad was 90% garbanzo beans. The tuna was very strong tasting and stringy felt like it was quite old. The minestrone soup was good and the chicken porta Polo was good. pricing OK.
Great pasta dishes. I had the meat sauce and my wife had the tomato sauce. Tasted very good and left nothing on the plates. The portion sizes were perfect for lunch.
Excellent Italian restaurant! We tried the Nobile Pizza and it was great! Great food, great service and great ambiance!
If you want to eat good and fast you have to go there. It is a great place with a great design and the food is really good and tasty. It is not that expensive.
Excellent salads and pasta. Always an easy quick and simple option for those in midtown west. It is a nice option for families with small kids since they have kid's menu.
Amazing lasagne!! I've been searching for good lasagne for years, and this would have to be the softest and tastiest ive ever had! I would highly recommend it
My husband and I stopped in for a quick late dinner and were nothing but pleased! The food was excellent even the simple pasta dish and panini. Definitely recommend it!
We have eaten here a few times for a quick meal while on our travels. The lasagne is delicious and tastes like a home cooked meal. I like that it's a casual setting or you can get takeaway.
It was a rainy evening and our hotel was close. Food was good and reasonably priced for NYC. Nothing fancy, almost a fast food restaurant. Portions were good sized.
It was a fine restaurant the price was low and the meal was high quality! The servers were very kind and attentive to the table.

Stopped in for quick lunch. Margherita pizza was "good." Small enough for a 16 year old boy. Tortellini Alfredo was quite good and enjoyed by 12 year old daughter. Focaccia Bologna was average. Not a ton of flavor. The least favorite.

column3: Bland food - Don't waste your money
column4: This was undercooked pasta and no seasoning anywhere. I'm ashamed that I spent money at this restaurant when there was so much better food all over the place.
A genuine Italian bistro type restaurant in the NY theatre district. Had pizza, salad, pasta with my wife and 2 kids. You cannot go wrong!
Relaxed dining in a lovely atmosphere. Fabulous pasta and pizza served fresh and hot and quickly. Well priced
Foods ok but there's so many better places in the big city better worthy of your money. Fast food style Italian at relatively cheap price.
Very Nice - good t asty food. Moderately priced & quick service. Order at counter sit down & get served - Cafeteria atmosphere.
Food fine, service poor. Pizza was out and almost finished with before salad came. Employees standing around talking
Great place for a quick lunch. Order at the counter and your food is brought out quickly and efficiently. The lasagna wasn't the best but the spaghetti was perfect al dente.
We stayed a Hotel across the road so Barilla Restaurant was a convenient option. We had wood fried pizza with wine. It is simple but great and inexpensive. We would be back.
The food is good and they serve it quickly. Right quality of the products, nice restaurant. Perfect if you are looking for a place to eat quickly and good.

column3: Reasonably priced mid-town place to eat
column4: This is the place to eat if you're looking for a quick but decent meal, and not junk food. They serve good pastas for a reasonable price. I've also taken the soup, and it was very nice.

column3: Great taste - good value - super location
column4: Rare needle in a haystack Opposite Bryant Park and stone's throw from Times Square Great tasting pizza and good value---a firm favourite
It's your fast food Italian with a touch of great taste and good enough numbers of choices of the dishes, from pizza to pasta to salad or sandwich...
We had a look at which restaurants were available in the nearby of the Rockefeller Centre for lunching. The service was quick, the food very good and at a decent price level.
This is a no nonsense pasta place. Visited several times and every time the pasta is good. They also do sandwiches and pizza. Quick service. Nice to drop in for a quick bite.
I love Italian food and this restaurant with every single choice on the menu you cannot go wrong. Eat anything. And cheap.
Great salad and served withing 5 minutes of ordering. Trendy decor and pleasant atmosphere. Would recommend for a lunch/takeaway.
It is a small Italy in the center of The city!if you would like to eat something different than hamburger, than you should check it!
Love this place. Food is absolutely amazing for this price. Pastas taste almost like in Italy. Recommend anyone who wants to eat good Italian food and doesn't want to spend much money.
We found this restaurant by chance while searching for a restaurant. The food was good. It`s only hard to find a seat there cause it was full.

Great casual spot directly across the street from Bryant Park. Food is not gourmet but tasty, well-portioned, and fairly priced for NYC. Plenty of seating at both tables and a raised counter. Cheerful, helpful staff on a busy Sunday afternoon. Beer and wine available.

column3: Good fresh food at a great price
column4: Found this by accident and loved it. Great salads, pastas and paninis. Pizza okay. Everything is cooked up fresh and is very moderately priced, especially for NYC. 3 of us ate for $50.
Pizza was okay, pastas were nice, nothing amazing just decent Italian. We would return. Not that cheap but we are in New York
We came to this restaurant after going to a Broadway show. It has good food but nothing fancy. It's better than a fast food place
Had breakfast one morning perfect omelet with small crusty bread perfect Italian style portion, went back for a panini next day also delicious sausage with peepers and caramelized of onions.
Fast service. Fresh, delicious food. Had spaghetti with sausage and margarita pizza. Dishes came out within 5 minutes.

We ve been there for some quickly food. I love italian pasta so i asked for a carbonara. Guess what. They dont have carbonara. I couldnt imagine that there is an italian place in this world without carbonara pasta. Pizza was just average.
Ate here twice on recent 5 day trip. Freshly prepared pastas and pizzas which were absolutely gorgeous. Very reasonably priced too. Approx $10 per person!!!! Fab
Excellent pasta and pizza. Value for money. If you are around the area, give it a try, totally recommended
Popped into here one evening. We're staying near Bryant Park so it was very convenient. We all Ordered pasta dishes & a side salad. Good portions & tasty food. Quick & tasty meal.
Just walked in after a long walk... Very good pizza and lasagna. Everything cooked right Prices very fair for location and size...

column3: Great Italian in very comfortable caf√© atmosphere
column4: Excellent experience and great Italian food. We had traditional spaghetti and meatballs, salad, and capricciosa flat bread. All outstanding and the butternut squash soup was to die for!
Good Italian fast food at good price. Best Italian food I've had in Nyc . We had pizza , lasagna , steak sandwich , spaghetti Primavera all excellent
The food was really solid but definitely seemed more fast food/commercialized than I was expecting. It's pretty inexpensive as well. Perfect for a lunch.

It was good and affordable italian food in a tourist area. No waiter service so you save there The pasta dish was decent sized and the larger Pizza was good to share for 1.5 person. You can pass on the basic salad...not worth the $9
Pasta dish was comparably small but the pizza was good. Nothing more to add at this point, thank you

The food was excellent. We got spaghetti with meatballs and it came with real Parmesan cheese which was a very nice touch. Came back a second time and got the pizza. Wife got a salad which she enjoyed. Very good service as well.
When you don't have much time or don't want to spend much money, it's like a pasta fast food. The food is discent and cheep..
Loveeeeee this place!!!! The food is just great!!!! We came back again after a day! The pastas was delicious! The staff is nice and smily, especially loved the tirimiso - best dessert ever!!!!!
Very good food for a very reasonable price. Pizza and pasta is very good. I would avoid the soup. Soup does not have much flavor and it was cold.

column3: Small but good eats. Reasonably Priced
column4: This is like a fast food bistro, but it's very good italian food and fast, but kind of noisy. If you are staying near Radio City Music Hall, please eat here.
Great place for a bite to eat and to have a nice glass of wine. Good for a date night. Food was reasonably priced for the area.
Nice restaurant in busy city, very reasonable prices with real Italian taste. Nice decoration and ambience you need to order and pay first
While in new york last month visited here twice for lunch. Had a pizza both times which was one of the nicest pizzas ive ever had. Quite cheap compared to typical new york prices
Came here today for a quick breakfast. Unfortunately it doesn't open until 9am on Saturdays, so I had to come back later. Coffee and croissant were both good, if a little overpriced.

Ate here this evening based on the high rating on TripAdvisor. It is well deserved. Good selection of pasta dishes and other Italian staples in a quiet setting. Food was reasonably priced, served almost immediately, and was very well presented and delicious.

column3: Good for for a good price
column4: Family of four. Had Chicken linguini, pizza, and spaghetti. Very good. Cost $51 with drinks. About the best you'll get for a sit-down restaurant in Manhattan.
Good pasta at an attractive price in a nice and quiet place. I advice it. The expresso is also good......................
we looked for some cheap and good place to eat. we found this one! the food was really good! i ate the soup and pasta with meatballs . worth the price . taste really good. sure i will come back !
Very nice place with a various choice of tipical italian food, well cooked from the italian tradition and good quality ingredients.

column3: Great food, great location, great service!!!
column4: This restaurant is one of the best options for dining in NYC! friendly staff, great food and service are perfectly combined, is definitely one of my favorite restaurants in NYC!
Besides the food carts, there's not much to eat near 52nd, so Academia Barilla is a sure bet! Pasta & Panini are as good as anything you'll find in little Italy!!
Good vfm if you're hungry. Pasta looks interesting and probably more authentic Italian than the pizza which, though nice, was not very Italian
This is a nice place for a quick bite. Pasta and pizzas are really good. Nice portions, good flavor and great value. Worth it.
Looking for somewhere reasonably priced to eat then look no further. Great value for money and great Italian food. Well worth trying.
We grabbed a cup of coffee here. We sure liked the atmosphere in this restaurant, it's very modern, quiet and relaxing. And the price is very inexpensive.
Great pasta! We had a vegetable lasagna and fusillis for lunch and they were both really good! No doubts that I will come back. Excellent choice for pasta in NYC.
We ordered pasta and it was very good. Prices weren't high and the staff was friendly. The atmosphere was nice and foods arrived fast.

column3: Excellent Pasta + panini and pizza and more
column4: All the foods most proper italian foods are excellent staff and weiter professionel and polite and in top of that sometimes the restaurant make you to taste new foods or kind of pizza for free ... you have to try this restaurant !
I went to this restaurant for breakfast. You can have a kind of European breakfast with omelette, bread and marmelade. The coffee is the best coffee in NY.

Great restaurant, second time here within a few days and didn't disappoint. Pizzas and pastas are great! Everyone enjoyed their orders, even my daughter who's a very picky eater. Highly recommended! Only bad thing was that they don't have highchairs.

column3: Good value, good quality, convenient place
column4: Discovered thanks to Tripadviser, it's a nice place for a quick lunch, in a convenient place at "reasonable" cost ( for NYC standards !!!) Pizzas are very pleasant for European travelers (thin and crusty) pastas are simple but could be slightly larger portions (!!!)
Ate here a couple of times over the course of a week, always had great food especially the pasta, very quick service, and very good value overall.

We went there for dinner,it is a place similar to the European "Vapiano" ,but smaller. The pizza was good the pasta was just okay,nothing special. The service is okay and the atmosphere is nice,but a bit like a FastFood place.
Amazing ambiance ... Cozy environment ... Excellent service ... and the food!!! Wonderful, is the only way I could describe it ...

We had one Bolognese and one Alfredo. Fresh pasta, excellent taste. Were offered additional parmesane cheese. Every thing in the restaurant was spotlessly clean, we spend a nice hour watching the different dishes that were services. Very recommended!

The restaurant is clean and comfortable. Food was fantastic and affordable. Only negative part was the host came to our table too often to clean even though there were not many people having meal at the place.

We actually went back to this place 3x's during our visit to NYC. Atmosphere was great, food was really good and the location was great as well. We actually watched the Macy's Parade from inside this place while eating breakfast. Highly recommend!

I based my visit on the reviews here. The food was OK, but I was surprised. Imagine if Panera were an Italian restaurant. It's cafeteria style and corporate marketing polish. There was no atmosphere or authenticity.
What a pleasant surprise ! We had pizza to die for, it was better than most restaurants ! What a great experience and highly recommended.
Good food, prompt service :) good wine as well. Keep up the good work ! Lasagna , fusilli montanara both very good, so was insalata ruspante.
Friendly staff and the first time in awhile that I've stood in a restaurant unable to make up mind because so many things on the menu looked so good. Very reasonable prices.

Great concept with good and affordable food. They have a deal where you get a glass of wine with your pasta for an incredible price. Nice setting. Great place to stop off for a fast but decent meal after a day of sightseeing. Highly recommended.

We stopped here for breakfast and it was so nice and refreshing. The interior is so pleasant and calming. Our pastries were amazing and the coffee was delicious. It was the perfect start to a great day in the city.
Very nice, modern, food was very good, not pretentious, prices are ok as well, service is fast ... not so easy to find, were standing 30 feet from the entrance and could not see it :)

Very good restaurant with quit fast service, fresh food and pretty nice coffee. We've ordered 2 pastas and they were great. We've also seen very tasty looking pizzas. The price is decent. Reccomend it!
Pizza was excellent, the location is just across the street from MOMA, selection great, interior design very nice, all in all, a great discovery and highly recommended.

Hard to find because the map on tripadvisor points to 56th street. Once you get there it's a plentiful menu with lots of options for all tastes. Prices are excellent for quality and portions are generous.
This is a very relaxed restaurant with excellent italian food. Children friendly although they do not do child portions. The pizzas were a hit with the kids and we enjoyed the pasta dishes.

column3: Good food, good service, nice atmosphere
column4: Very good pizza, fresh salad, good soup. The restaurant is a nice setting to enjoy an excellent meal.

Perfect stop for yummy lunch......fresh, delicious. We sampled pasta, paninis and pizza....all good. Kid friendly and reasonably priced. Manager kept checking on us and gave my daughter some delicious Mulino Bianco cookies......highly recommend

I have been there a couple of times and the restaurant has a nice atmosphere and the place itself is quite cozy. It definitely is not pricey compared to other italian branded spots. Food is quite good I suggest it as italian woman.

I went there for a quick lunch after a business meeting. It was great: fast service, friendly atmosphere and most of all, delicious food. A corner of Italy in the middle of the Big Apple. Highly recommended.
I wanted to load some carbs before an afternoon run by the Hudson... and what's better than pasta? Here it was Italian and pretty good, with fast service and a decent price.
My son brought me here for lunch and it was like being back home for a little while. Good pasta, and choice of typical sauces.
Great place to get an authentic taste of Italy: unpretentious and genuine dishes, ideal for a quick but filling lunch.

column3: Great Italian food at a great price!
column4: I love Barilla pasta and wanted to try out the restaurant for myself! The environment is great and the food even better. I definitely recommend the Penne Amatriciana -- delicious!

I was in New York and found this place. The position is very good.... so close to the Rockfeller Center. I had spaghetti with meatballs. Good taste and generous portions. Value for money very good. I recommend this place!
Good brand and location. Barilla has definitely made its mark in the world making it probably the most recognized pasta brand in the world.

Great, affordable, Italian food in a modern atmosphere near Rockefeller Center. An excellent place to come if you're with picky eaters or kids. Has a modern grocery feel that's excellent for a quick bite. Great service, great food, and lots of options- can't go wrong!

Had Penne w/spicy tomato sauce, my favorite, was absolutely incredible! Pasta Fagiola was very, very tasty, too. Got a bottle of the olive oil for the road and can't put it down. Can't wait to go back. Highly recommend!
Lots of NY restaurants make good Italian food and this is surely one of them. Food is great and there's a nice atmosphere. Veggie pastas are yummy. Definitely recommended.

column3: Authentic Italian "Fast" Food at Down-to-Earth Prices
column4: In the middle of the most expensive center of Manhattan, here's a variety of delicious, beautifully prepared Italian dishes, all at very reasonable prices. Sandwiches, pizza, salads, soups, cold cut & cheese platters, and a wide variety of pasta dishes. Wine, beer and Italian soft...More

A perfect combination of good food, value, and quality in a laid back environment. I stopped in with my family on Saturday and was nicely impressed. I ordered the tagliatelle ragu, my family also ordered pasta dishes(pomodoro & seafood one) and we were all very happy! We have all been to Parma and Barilla did not disappoint our expectations. Highly recommend it! Now they just need to add gelato!

I met some friend there and we spent a couple of hours drinking wine, eating and talking.... Food is very good, the pizza capricciosa is awesome and we felt it was a very cozy place eventhough it was more than a "fast-food" than a formal restaurant. It is like an italian "Panera" but GOOD...!!!! :)

column3: A piece of Italy in NY
column4: it's been a very good experience! We didn't know Barilla was in New York with a restaurant, we usually eat their pasta and products at home so we were interested and entered. They did a wonderful job, the place is warm and cozy, quiet and the service is fast and nice (we had some bad examples before in other places..) I had a ciabatta with ham and cheese, and shared a pizza with vegetables. both tasty, crusty! the ingredients were fresh, light and healthy, and it's the best thing if you have to visit museums after! we also tried the desserts: the tiramisu was excellent, just like i'm used to make it. what I liked most was the typical italian tastes and ways of cooking. this is a real italian restaurants abroad! another positive point: the prices, we spent 30$ and we ate so much! go and try if you're planning a visit in the big apple!
Lots of NY restaurants make good Italian food and this is surely one of them. Food is great and there's a nice atmosphere. Veggie pastas are yummy. Definitely recommended.

column3: Delicious! Perfect for the whole family!
column4: We stopped at Barilla for lunch on a recent trip to NYC. The family loved it! The picky eaters enjoyed the authentic pizza! While hubby enjoyed the best Panini with Mortadella. Just like home he said, Italian that he is. Mom, watching her figure, savored the soup and salad. Cute spot! Even left with some pasta and olive oil! Definitely worth the visit.

column3: Authentic Italian "Fast" Food at Down-to-Earth Prices
column4: In the middle of the most expensive center of Manhattan, here's a variety of delicious, beautifully prepared Italian dishes, all at very reasonable prices. Sandwiches, pizza, salads, soups, cold cut & cheese platters, and a wide variety of pasta dishes. Wine, beer and Italian soft drinks. Superb coffee all day long. Kids will love it too. A relaxing place to eat, we especially enjoyed watching the video of master chefs preparing pasta dishes at the cooking school in Parma.

A perfect combination of good food, value, and quality in a laid back environment. I stopped in with my family on Saturday and was nicely impressed. I ordered the tagliatelle ragu, my family also ordered pasta dishes(pomodoro & seafood one) and we were all very happy! We have all been to Parma and Barilla did not disappoint our expectations. Highly recommend it! Now they just need to add gelato!

I met some friend there and we spent a couple of hours drinking wine, eating and talking.... Food is very good, the pizza capricciosa is awesome and we felt it was a very cozy place eventhough it was more than a "fast-food" than a formal restaurant. It is like an italian "Panera" but GOOD...!!!! :)
